[shocked] They want me to come back? To Millbrook? I mean, I haven't been home in what, six years? [pause] God, it's gotta be Henderson Manufacturing. Has to be. They're the only company big enough to... hmm, to actually afford me. [bitter] Funny how they wouldn't even interview me out of college, and now they're desperate enough to call. [short pause] 

The thing is, I'm actually really good at this. [confidently] Twelve companies saved, not a single failure. But this is, uh... this is different, you know? These are people who knew me when I was just Danny from Pine Street. [nervous] People who remember when I couldn't even get a job bagging groceries. 

[sigh] Mom's going to be thrilled though. She'll tell everyone at church—"My Danny's saving Henderson's!" [mumbling] Like I'm some kind of hometown hero or something. 

[hesitantly] I don't know, maybe I should pass on this one? Let someone else... [pause] No. No, that's ridiculous. It's a job. Just another failing company that needs fixing. [very slowly] Except it's not just another company, is it? [quietly] It's where Dad worked for thirty years before they laid him off.

subject: Your turnaround specialist reputation just earned you a call to save a company in your hometown
